con:interface.name: Health Data Service Interface (HDSI)
con:interface.con:description: Represents SanteDB Server implementation of the the Health Data Service Interface (HDSI) contract

con:method.name: OPTIONS
con:method.con:description: Options

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: This method can be used to retrieve individual numbered schemas from the service Get the schema of the HDSI API for use in code generation frameworks

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: The search operation calls the database and loads results either from cache or data store. Care should be taken in the number of results retrieved by this operation. Perform a search (query) for

con:parameter.con:name: _offset
con:parameter.con:description: Offset of query results

con:parameter.con:name: _count
con:parameter.con:description: Count of query results to include in result set

con:parameter.con:name: _orderBy
con:parameter.con:description: Indicates a series of parameters to order the result set by

con:parameter.con:name: _includeRefs
con:parameter.con:description: True if all referenced objects should be loaded

con:parameter.con:name: _lean
con:parameter.con:description: When true, the server will only return minimal data by removing duplicates from the bundle's resource[] property. NOTE: This means that the .count parameter may not match the number of items in resource[], however you should continue to use the .count parameter to increase your offset

con:parameter.con:name: _all
con:parameter.con:description: True if all properties should be expanded

con:parameter.con:name: _expand
con:parameter.con:description: The names of the properties which should be forced loaded

con:parameter.con:name: _exclude
con:parameter.con:description: The names of the properties which should removed from the bundle

con:parameter.con:name: isNegated
con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets an indicator which identifies whether the act actually occurred, or specifically did not occur

con:parameter.con:description: Gets the template UUID upon which this act is based

con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the moment in time that this act occurred in ISO format

con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the time when the act should or did stop ocurring in ISO format

con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the key of the concept which specifies the mood of the act.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This operation (like the _code operation) generates a digitally signed pointer for an object. Rather than rendering that pointer as a visual code, the API will return the structured contents of that code so the client can best determine how to represent the data.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the digitally signed pointer (in JWS format) for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This operation is a CREATE ONLY operation, and will throw an error if the operation results in a duplicate. If you are looking for a CREATE OR UPDATE method use the POST with identifier operation Creates the resource. If the resource already exists, then a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: OPTIONS
con:method.con:description: Returns specific options for a single resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.con:description:
This operation (like the _code operation) generates a digitally signed pointer for an object. Rather than rendering that pointer as a visual code, the API will return the structured contents of that code so the client can best determine how to represent the data.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This operation (like the _code operation) generates a digitally signed pointer for an object. Rather than rendering that pointer as a visual code, the API will return the structured contents of that code so the client can best determine how to represent the data.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the digitally signed pointer (in JWS format) for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This operation (like the _code operation) generates a digitally signed pointer for an object. Rather than rendering that pointer as a visual code, the API will return the structured contents of that code so the client can best determine how to represent the data.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the digitally signed pointer (in JWS format) for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.con:description: This method will first use cache to locate the most recent copy before searching the database. It is recommended to use this method rather than a query to Resource?id={id} Retrieves the current version of the specified resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.con:description:
This operation (like the _code operation) generates a digitally signed pointer for an object. Rather than rendering that pointer as a visual code, the API will return the structured contents of that code so the client can best determine how to represent the data.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the digitally signed pointer (in JWS format) for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

This operation (like the _code operation) generates a digitally signed pointer for an object. Rather than rendering that pointer as a visual code, the API will return the structured contents of that code so the client can best determine how to represent the data.

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This operation (like the _code operation) generates a digitally signed pointer for an object. Rather than rendering that pointer as a visual code, the API will return the structured contents of that code so the client can best determine how to represent the data.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the digitally signed pointer (in JWS format) for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This operation (like the _code operation) generates a digitally signed pointer for an object. Rather than rendering that pointer as a visual code, the API will return the structured contents of that code so the client can best determine how to represent the data.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the digitally signed pointer (in JWS format) for the resource

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: This method will attempt to update the resource if it exists (a-la PUT style) however, if a PUT fails the operation will create (a-la POST) Creates or updates a resource. That is, creates the resource if it does not exist, or updates it if it does

con:method.name: PUT
con:method.con:description:
This operation will update an existing resource on the server such that the data in the database exactly matches the data passed via the API.
Note: If you post an incomplete object (such as one missing identifiers, or addresses) then the current resource will have those attributes removed. For partial updates, use the PATCH operation instead. Updates the specified resource. If the resource does not exist than a 404 is thrown, if there is a conflict (such a mismatch of data) a 409 is thrown

con:method.name: DELETE
con:method.con:description: This operation logically deletes the identified resource so that it no longer appears in general searches, however the data is retained. Deletes the specified resource from the server

con:method.name: PATCH
con:method.con:description:
The PATCH operation allows for partial updating of a resource.
This method must be used in conjunction with an If-Match header indicating the version that you would like apply the patch against.
The server will load the most recent version and compre the version code with If-Match, if the match is successful the instructions in the PATCH are applied to the loaded version. Updates the specified resource according to the instructions in the PATCH file

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Invokes the specified operation

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the operation

con:parameter.con:name: operationName
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the operation

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
This method returns a barcode which explicitly points at the specified resource in the specified authority.
The barcode is generated using the server's configuration, and is signed by the server's signing key.
For complete specification see: https://help.santesuite.org/santedb/extending-santedb/service-apis/health-data-service-interface-hdsi/digitally-signed-visual-code-api Gets the specified barcode for the resource

con:parameter.con:name: policy
con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the security policy instances associated with the entity

con:parameter.con:name: previousVersion
con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the UUID of the previous version of this record

con:parameter.con:name: version
con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the UUID of the current version of this object

con:parameter.con:name: sequence
con:parameter.con:description: The sequence number of the version (for ordering)

con:parameter.con:name: creationTime
con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the creation time as an ISO date format

con:parameter.con:name: obsoletionTime
con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the time that the data is no longer valid (was deleted/obsoleted) in ISO format

con:parameter.con:name: modifiedOn
con:parameter.con:description: Gets the time that the object was last modified (from base data, default to CreationTime)

con:parameter.con:name: createdBy
con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the security provenance object which represents the creation of this object

con:parameter.con:name: obsoletedBy
con:parameter.con:description: Gets or sets the security provenance object which represents the obsoletion of this data

con:parameter.con:name: _offset
con:parameter.con:description: Offset of query results

con:parameter.con:name: _count
con:parameter.con:description: Count of query results to include in result set

con:parameter.con:name: _lean
con:parameter.con:description: When true, the server will only return minimal data by removing duplicates from the bundle's resource[] property. NOTE: This means that the .count parameter may not match the number of items in resource[], however you should continue to use the .count parameter to increase your offset

con:parameter.con:name: _orderBy
con:parameter.con:description: Indicates a series of parameters to order the result set by

con:parameter.con:name: _queryId
con:parameter.con:description: The unique identifier for the query (for continuation)

con:parameter.con:name: _viewModel
con:parameter.con:description: When using the view-model content-type, the view model to use

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Time

con:interface.name: HL7 Fast Health Interoperability Resources (FHIR) R4
con:interface.con:description: SanteSB Server implementation of the HL7 FHIR R4 Contract
